metadata.title: CVE-2016-2168 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The req_check_access function in the mod_authz_svn module in the httpdserver in Apache Subversion before 1.8.16 and 1.9.x before 1.9.4 allowsremote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference and crash) via a crafted header in a (1) MOVE or (2) COPYrequest, involving an authorization check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3.3').
